briefdescription.para: Exit with non-zero status after error message.
Print error text; Call perror(""); exit(errno);.
Print error message to error log.
Print warning message to error log.
Print logging information to standard error stream.
Continue printing the information to standard error stream.
Print debugging information to standard error stream.

detaileddescription.para:
This will only print a message if:
Debugging is enabled at compile time
The debug level is greater than or equal to level
Note that for portability reasons the format and arguments must be enclosed in an extra set of parentheses.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* err_cb_f) (void *user_data, err_lvl_t, const char *,...)
memberdef.name: err_cb_f

memberdef.argsstring: (err_lvl_t lvl, const char *path, long ln, const char *fmt,...)
memberdef.name: err_msg

memberdef.argsstring: (err_lvl_t lvl, const char *path, long ln, const char *fmt,...)
memberdef.name: err_msg_system

briefdescription.para: Sets function to output error messages.

detaileddescription.para: Use it to redirect the logging to your application. By default the handler which dumps messages to stderr is set.

briefdescription.para: Direct all logging to a given filehandle if default logfp callback is set.

parameterdescription.para: Filehandle to send log messages to, or NULL to disable logging.

simplesect.para: Current logging filehandle, NULL if logging is disabled. Initially it returns stderr

briefdescription.para: Append all log messages to a given file.

detaileddescription.para: Previous logging filehandle is closed (unless it was stdout or stderr).

parameterdescription.para: File path to send log messages to

simplesect.para: 0 for success, <0 for failure (e.g. if file does not exist)

detaileddescription.para: Note that debugging messages are only enabled when compiled with -DDEBUG.

parameterdescription.para: Verbosity level to set, or 0 to disable debug messages.

detaileddescription.para: Note that debugging messages are only enabled when compiled with -DDEBUG.

Logging, warning, debug and error message output funtionality is provided in this file. Sphinxbase defines several level of logging messages - INFO, WARNING, ERROR, FATAL. By default output goes to standard error output.

Logging is implemented through macros. They take same arguments as printf: format string and values. By default source file name and source line are prepended to the message. Log output could be redirected to any file using err_set_logfp() and err_set_logfile() functions. To disable logging in your application, call err_set_logfp(NULL).
It's possible to log multiline info messages, to do that you need to start message with E_INFO and output other lines with E_INFOCONT.
